text: I have outed you I have outed you is not
a music lover or a music enjoyer
but a contrarian while I still prefer
old music you has opened my eyes to many
a music Thank You Gyo Gyo Gyo Gyo hi
everyone Anthony Fantana here Internet's
busiest music nerd and it's time for a
review black breath sentenced to life
this is a sophomore album whose album
cover I could stare at all day visually
this covers like a combination of black
flags damaged and Anthrax's Fistful of
metal but these guys definitely bring it
in to over the top territory by bringing
in a sledge hammer to get their point
across now I first heard of these guys
in 2009 on their debut EP razor to
oblivion southern Lord Records released
it and then and the EP was just a
handful of songs that were a rough in
raw fusion of hardcore punk and metal
and around this time period southern
Lords started picking up a lot of Punk
and metal hybrids males all pigs must
die track them the secret and black
breath delivers this style with some
extreme intensity now the band's
full-length album that dropped in 2010 I
wasn't totally into I felt like it lost
a bit of personality that razor to
oblivion had it was a little
inconsistent in style too but it still
had some great qualities the band
definitely came through with thicker
production this time around on out just
relentless with these vocals that have
become more fierce and buzzsaw guitar
tones that really cut through your skull
I still think it's an album that is a
very nice stepping stone to what the
band is doing on this new album
sentenced to life on this LP just songs
that are set to the speed of punk thrash
riffs D beads come in every direction
from the drums ferocious vocals tremolo
picked death metal melodies and the
occasional blast bein break
down just to kind of add some variety to
the album you know an LP that's this
extreme can run into two issues one
there's not enough change there's not
enough variation all the songs end up
sounding the same and it just becomes
kind of boring
another issue can be that it is too long
and that issue becomes an even bigger
issue when the first issue is an issue
but black breath is able to keep things
high-intensity high adrenaline while
still adding some character to nearly
every one of these songs just take the
vocal break on the opening track feast
of the Damned yes and the descending
guitar lead on forced into possession
feels like just being thrown into the
pits of hell and I also love how the
band can really kind of slow things down
like on the track home of the grave or
the really brooding dark intro on
endless corpse but still keep things
kind of interesting and while we're on
the subject of endless corpse I love the
syncopated drum hits that just fly in
quickly to transition that track from
this really kind of dark moody intro to
just fast-paced and the song hits so
hard the band plays so freakin fast
really quick really accurate but far
from robotic I love this on mother or
piss off of this track too it starts off
with this really fiery wailing guitar
solo and it just feels like I am
listening to a thrash metal song on
steroids like I had grabbed a thrash
metal album circa 1985 I've thrown it on
the turntable crank the bass all the way
up and then played it at 45 rpm now
while there is a lot of just straight
into the point aggression on this album
there's quite a bit of detail to kind of
like a spiked bat with a beautifully
engraved handle there are a lot of
layers to the madness on sentence to
life it's just that the
outside to this album is is that at
first it comes off so overbearing it
comes off so extreme all those details
and the fact that these guys are
blending so many musical ideas together
in an interesting way does not become
obvious until a few lessons in what does
come off strong on this album is that
these guys are a sheer force I feel like
there are some tracks on here that could
have used a little more detail to
separate them from the rest like the
song doomed and yeah admittedly this
album is difficult to connect with on
any other level than than vast spaces
and pure aggression but it conjures
those things so amazingly that I just
have to give it up
mmm kind of feeling a light eight to a
decent eight on this album what did you
guys think of it did you love it
did you hate it why and what should I
review next anthony Fantana black breath
